description: From French symptomatique, from New Latin symptomaticus, from Ancient Greek συμπτωματικός (sumptōmatikós, “of or pertaining to a chance (or a symptom), casual”), from σύμπτωμα (súmptōma, “a symptom”). By surface analysis, symptom +‎ -atic.

adjectives.description: symptomatic (comparative more symptomatic, superlative most symptomatic)

entries.meaning: Relating to, based on, or constituting a symptom.
examples: The city's problems are symptomatic of the crisis that is spreading throughout the country.

entries.meaning: A person exhibiting the symptoms of an illness.
